SEARCH
Package GameEngine

Class GameEditLogic

java.lang.Object
GameEngine.GameEditLogic
public class GameEditLogic extends Object
Logic for the map editor, handling grid initialization and map creation.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameEditLogic

      public GameEditLogic()
      Constructor for GameEditLogic. Initializes the grid and walls.

  • Method Details

    • getGrid

      public Room[][] getGrid()
      Retrieves the room grid representing the current map layout. Each cell contains room properties and item/lever placements.
      Returns:
      the 2D array of rooms in the editor grid

    • getHWalls

      public boolean[][] getHWalls()
      Retrieves the horizontal walls array representing walls between vertically adjacent rooms. hWalls[x][y] represents a wall between rooms (x, y-1) and (x, y).
      Returns:
      the 2D boolean array of horizontal walls

    • getVWalls

      public boolean[][] getVWalls()
      Retrieves the vertical walls array representing walls between horizontally adjacent rooms. vWalls[x][y] represents a wall between rooms (x-1, y) and (x, y).
      Returns:
      the 2D boolean array of vertical walls

    • getPendingLeverPos

      public Point getPendingLeverPos()
      Retrieves the current pending lever position waiting for wall link confirmation. When a lever is placed, it enters "pending" state until linked to a wall.
      Returns:
      the pending lever position as a Point, or null if no lever is pending

    • setPendingLeverPos

      public void setPendingLeverPos(Point pendingLeverPos)
      Sets the pending lever position for the active lever awaiting wall link confirmation.
      Parameters:
      pendingLeverPos - the position of the lever being placed, or null to clear

    • initializeGrid

      public void initializeGrid()
      Initializes the editor grid with default rooms for a blank map. Creates rooms for all grid positions and marks corners as entrance rooms and the center 3x3 area as the central zone. Walls are not initialized here.

    • createGameMapFromEditor

      public GameMapGenerator createGameMapFromEditor()
      Converts the current editor state into a playable GameMapGenerator instance. Creates a new map with all rooms, applies item and lever placements, and converts wall states into bidirectional connections. Reconstructs lever-to-wall relationships to ensure puzzle mechanics remain intact.
      Returns:
      a new GameMapGenerator configured from the current editor state

    • doesLeverTargetWall

      public boolean doesLeverTargetWall(Lever lever, int wallX, int wallY, boolean isVertical)
      Determines whether a specific lever targets a particular wall. Checks if any of the lever's target connections correspond to the given wall by comparing room coordinates and wall orientation.
      Parameters:
      lever - the lever to check
      wallX - the x-coordinate of the wall
      wallY - the y-coordinate of the wall
      isVertical - true if checking vertical wall, false for horizontal wall
      Returns:
      true if the lever targets this wall, false otherwise

    • isWallTargeted

      public boolean isWallTargeted(int wallX, int wallY, boolean isVertical)
      Checks whether any lever in the map targets a specific wall. Scans all rooms in the editor grid to find levers and checks if any target the given wall using doesLeverTargetWall method.
      Parameters:
      wallX - the x-coordinate of the wall
      wallY - the y-coordinate of the wall
      isVertical - true if checking vertical wall, false for horizontal wall
      Returns:
      true if any lever in the map targets this wall, false otherwise

    • removeLeverLinkedToWall

      public void removeLeverLinkedToWall(int wallX, int wallY, boolean isVertical)
      Removes any lever that targets a specific wall when that wall is toggled. This maintains puzzle validity by preventing levers from controlling non-existent connections when walls change states.
      Parameters:
      wallX - the x-coordinate of the wall
      wallY - the y-coordinate of the wall
      isVertical - true if toggling vertical wall, false for horizontal wall

    • clearMap

      public void clearMap()
      Clears all map content by removing items, levers, and walls. Resets the map to a blank slate with all walls removed (complete maze with all passages open). Used when starting a fresh map design in the editor.

    • loadFromGameMap

      public void loadFromGameMap(GameMapGenerator map)
      Initializes editor grid and walls from an existing GameMapGenerator. Reconstructs editor state by setting walls based on available connections in the game map, then overlays item and lever states to preserve puzzle configuration. Walls default to true (complete maze) and are opened only where connections exist.
      Parameters:
      map - the GameMapGenerator to load editor state from

    • cancelLeverPlacement

      public boolean cancelLeverPlacement()
      Cancels the pending lever placement in the editor. Removes the lever from its temporary location and clears the pending state.
      Returns:
      true if a pending lever placement was cancelled, false if no pending placement existed

    • modifyCell

      public boolean modifyCell(int x, int y, int selectedTool)
      Modifies a cell's content based on the selected editor tool. Enforces mutual exclusivity among items and levers - placing one type removes others. Protected cells (corners and center area) cannot be modified.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the cell to modify
      y - the y-coordinate of the cell to modify
      selectedTool - the editor tool identifier (pickaxe, ender pearl, lever, or question)
      Returns:
      true if lever placement mode should be enabled (waiting for wall link), false otherwise

    • linkLeverToWall

      public boolean linkLeverToWall(Point leverPos, int wallX, int wallY, boolean isVertical)
      Links a pending lever to a wall, creating bidirectional locked connections. Validates that the wall exists and is not already controlled by another lever. Only one lever may target any given wall to maintain clear puzzle relationships.
      Parameters:
      leverPos - the position of the lever to link
      wallX - the x-coordinate of the wall
      wallY - the y-coordinate of the wall
      isVertical - true if linking to vertical wall, false for horizontal wall
      Returns:
      true if linking succeeded or was cancelled (tools should unlock), false if invalid wall

    • toggleVWall

      public void toggleVWall(int x, int y)
      Toggles the state of a vertical wall between two rooms. When a wall opens (is removed), any lever that was controlling it is also removed to prevent invalid puzzle configurations with non-existent walls.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the vertical wall
      y - the y-coordinate of the vertical wall

    • toggleHWall

      public void toggleHWall(int x, int y)
      Toggles the state of a horizontal wall between two rooms. When a wall opens (is removed), any lever that was controlling it is also removed to prevent invalid puzzle configurations with non-existent walls.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the horizontal wall
      y - the y-coordinate of the horizontal wall
